name: Talochard
desc: An evidence clerk in the Marechaussee Phantom.

desc.text:
Hmph. You've gone down a bad path, Curve.
Secretly learning to lie without telling us is one thing, but to then immediately turn around and trick us? Are we even friends anymore?
Today, I'm making sure you get yours. Let's see how you like this trial of strength!
You owe us. You learned to lie thanks to us (that's what the Traveler and Paimon said), so show some gratitude.
On the other hand, I suppose I should also thank you lot. I don't think I hate liars as much as I did before spending time with you.
Just as you said — liars come in all forms.
People lie for the sake of face, children, family, and gain, to comfort others, to protect others...
Tangled lies weave the great web in which people live their lives, right?
Still, I don't think Dr. Mosso was right when he said that "a curve is the shortest distance between two people."
There are definitely some times when you should just shoot your shot straight.
For example, I miss you.

customize.text: Talochard, a Melusine, was once an aquabus guide on the Callas line. It used to travel to the Fontaine Research Institute, but service was suspended due to the explosion. Talochard was laid off due to complaints from tourists: some praised her in person but wrote complaints as soon as they got home. They said her voice grates like a crow. Editor Jenck from The Steambird was the first to complain about her voice. After the job on the aquabus line, she became an evidence clerk in the Marechaussee Phantom. One day she found a lie detector "Curve" in the evidence room. He was created by Dr. Mosso, a researcher from the Fontaine Research Institute. The researcher's true goal was to create a machine that would gradually become human by understanding lies and humanity.

If Curve would learn to lie like humans one day, it would mean that he was no longer bound by his machine programming, and had acquired human emotions. Not long after the existence of Dr. Mosso's lie detector was made public, The Steambird published several articles on it and quickly drew the public's attention. To save his creation, Dr. Mosso died defending himself in a court duel. Soon, everyone forgot about Curve, and he ended up in the Marechaussee Phantom evidence room. Curve's core was already thirty years old and was aging rapidly, so he would have gone into hibernation mode soon after Mosso's death. Talochard wanted him to see more about how humans lie and help him overcome the Mosso Protocols before hibernation.

Once, The Steambird's mascot, Sir Arthur, was stolen, and Talochard decided to take Curve with her to investigate this case. While passing near The Steambird, the Traveler and Paimon saw her arguing with editor Jenck and decided to intervene. Together, they gathered clues and started the investigation. Talochard had multiple suspects and she was straightforward to accuse each one of them of being a culprit. Despite being so impatient, Talochard found divided parts of Sir Arthur and discovered the connection between the pelican's kidnapping and the Fatui. Their investigation led them to Dr. Mosso's laboratory, where they met Jenck. It turned out that he was working with a Fatui Harbinger, who was interested in machines and had the order to find Dr. Mosso's research about Curve. Jenck met one of Talochard's suspects, a Fatui agent, who told him about Dr. Mosso's trial and that The Steambird made a mistake and published false evidence. He wanted to expose the truth so Chief Editor Euphrasie would be in trouble and Jenck could just take her place.

Before leaving the laboratory, Jenck activated the self-destruction system so Talochard and others would be buried inside. To save them, Curve lied to them so that they would leave him behind. When they were near the emergency exit, an explosion occurred, destroying Curve and flooding the laboratory. After returning Sir Arthur to safety, Talochard was told that Curve recorded a message on Sir Arthur about her: <color=#ffffffd9>"Based on my analysis… Agent Talochard! Will be the best agent in the Marechaussee Phantom!"</color> It seems that Curve started to break the protocols with Talochard's help and finally became a "human."

A few days later, Jenck was left in the Opera Epiclese. By the time he was found, he seemed to have lost his mind: he didn't react to any external stimuli at all, he was just kneeling on the stage of the Opera Epiclese. When the Maison Gardiennage examined him, they found that his tongue was missing, and in its place was a note apologizing to the Traveler, Paimon, and Talochard. No one knows if a Harbinger interested in machine intelligence got the data stolen by Jenck.
Near the Opera Epiclese, Talochard left a Lumidouce Bell, which alludes to "separations," and a letter for Curve.

<color=#ffffffd9>"Hmph. You've gone down a bad path, Curve.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Secretly learning to lie without telling us is one thing, but to then immediately turn around and trick us? Are we even friends anymore?</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Today, I'm making sure you get yours. Let's see how you like this trial of strength!</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>You owe us. You learned to lie thanks to us (that's what the Traveler and Paimon said), so show some gratitude.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>On the other hand, I suppose I should also thank you lot. I don't think I hate liars as much as I did before spending time with you.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Just as you said — liars come in all forms.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>People lie for the sake of face, children, family, and gain, to comfort others, to protect others...</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Tangled lies weave the great web in which people live their lives, right?</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Still, I don't think Dr. Mosso was right when he said that "a curve is the shortest distance between two people."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>There are definitely some times when you should just shoot your shot straight.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>For example, I miss you."</color>

customize.name: Court of Fontaine Region
customize.desc:
"This city alone stands above all waters."

Towering up at the highest point of the city, the Palais Mermonia represents the highest authority in Fontaine. Under its gaze, the people lead orderly lives that are as regular and predictable as the aquabus.

Law serves to maintain a stable order, which is in turn the cornerstone that equity and justice are built upon.

customize.name: Morte Region
customize.desc: Who knows how long the story guarded with the tall tower on the sea that the people ignore has been kept?

customize.name: "Curve"
customize.desc: A lie detector created by Dr. Mosso thirty years ago.

customize.name: Euphrasie
customize.desc: Euphrasie is the Chief Editor of The Steambird. She shoulders a great many responsibilities in addition to her work at the agency — she posts commissions for local residents' everyday troubles, assists the Palais Mermonia in putting up posters for criminals and dangerous monsters wanted by the Maison Gardiennage, and taps into the newspaper's powerful sources to find and contact people best suited for the missions... If you can solve problems for local citizens, maintain the order of the wilds of Fontaine, and build up your reputation steadily, you may earn rewards from different clients via Euphrasie...

customize.name: Talochard's Investigation Notes
customize.desc: These investigation notes shared by Talochard contain information on the missing Sir Arthur.

customize.name: Sir Arthur's Body
customize.desc:
A clockwork body that belonged to Sir Arthur.

What the criminal did was unforgivable!

customize.name: Sir Arthur's Head

customize.name: Sir Arthur's Wing

What the criminal did was unforgivable!

customize.name: Lumidouce Bell
customize.desc: A serene and tranquil violet flower. It has a light, soft, and lasting scent and is often used for making luxurious perfumes.

customize.name: Marechaussee Phantom
customize.desc: The personal unit of the Chief Justice Neuvillette, which is responsible for crime investigation. It is based in the Palais Mermonia and is one of the Maison Gardiennage's departments.

customize.text: Talochard is an employee of the Marechaussee Phantom. She used to be an aquabus guide and later became an evidence clerk.

customize.name: "Curve"
customize.desc: A lie detector created by Dr. Mosso thirty years ago.

customize.text:
An intelligent lie detector. Talochard wanted him to see more about how humans lie and help him to overcome the Mosso Protocols to become a real "human."
Jenck
The Steambird editor. He complained about Talochard's voice, that "grates like a crow."

customize.name: Rocher
customize.desc: Melo Lombroso's husband and a suspect in the kidnapping of Sir Arthur.

customize.name: Kevin
customize.desc: A suspect in the kidnapping of Sir Arthur.

customize.name: Baulande
customize.desc: The Fatui peripheral personnel. He is also known under a codename Baulard.

customize.name: "Intrepid Valberry"
customize.desc: A former member of the Fruity Order and the Elegant Tableware Confrerie.

customize.name: Talochard's Investigation Notes
